questions.question: In which of these places did Jesus live?
Why was Palestine invaded many times?

choices.answer: The Egyptians wanted revenge on the Jewish community
It is in a central location where Europe, Asia and Africa meet
The Babylonians were determined to take over Palestine
The Greeks didn't like people of monotheistic faiths

questions.question: Why was this central location significant?

choices.answer: Foreign occupiers could make Europeans, Asians and Africans polytheistic
It was a good location to occupy if war ever broke out
Foreign occupiers could charge tax on goods transferred across the country
It was near the River Nile which had the best drinking water at the time

questions.question: When did the Roman army invade Palestine?
When Palestine became part of the Roman Empire, who was in charge of Palestine and how it was ruled?

choices.answer: The Roman Empire was was fully in charge
Both the Empire and the Jews collectively made all of the decisions

questions.question: As Rome was a long way from Palestine, who did the emperor appoint to be in charge of the Palestinian provinces?
How many provinces were in Palestine?
Which of these was not a province in Palestine?
Which province was Jesus from?
Which village in Galilee was Jesus from?
The Romans charged the Jews tax. What did they do with this tax money?

choices.answer: Build a temple for the Jews so they could worship God
Build better roads and pay soldiers
Build a wall across the Palestine/Egyptian border

questions.question: Why did the Jews feel angry about this?

choices.answer: They should pay a tax in the land given to them by God
Because the Romans were spending the money for their own good

questions.question: Did the Romans allow the Jews to practise their religion?
In Nazareth, where Jesus lived, what were the houses like?

choices.answer: Very small: one room, one door, one small winder, people slept on mats.
Reasonably big: Three rooms, two doors, two windows, people slept on mats

questions.question: Animals often slept inside the house with the people in Nazareth at this time.
What did the Jewish people hang on their doors?
What was inside of a mezuzah?

choices.answer: A scroll with the words of a prayer from the Torah called the Shema
A scroll with the words of a prayer from the Roman Emperor

questions.question: What would the Jewish people do to the mezuzah do when they entered or left the house?
Which was NOT a common food for the Jewish community at the time of Jesus?
What was a Gentile?

choices.answer: A Jewish person who hung around with the Romans
A person who was not a Jew
A person who wouldn't pay any tax

questions.question: Which of these was a common role for Jewish boys at the time of Jesus?

choices.answer: Attend school at the synagogue, learn to read, write and do maths.
Learn to fight from an early age and join the army when they turned 12

questions.question: What did the girls do?

choices.answer: Stay at home and raise the family
Learn to read, write, do maths and cook all of the food.

questions.question: Which of these was not a typical job for Jewish men at this time?
What was the everyday language spoken in Palestine by the Jews at this time?
What is the name of the Jewish holy building or place of worship?
What was the role of the powerful religious group known as the Sadducees?

choices.answer: They controlled the Temple in Jerusalem and cooperated with the Romans
Controlled the synagogues, were experts of the Jewish law, avoided Romans

questions.question: What was the role of the powerful religious group known as the Pharisees?

choices.answer: Controlled the synagogues, were experts of the Jewish law, avoided Romans
They controlled the Temple in Jerusalem and cooperated with the Romans

questions.question: Because of the Bible, we know exactly what Jesus looks like
At the time of Jesus, people wore simple cloths made of wool
On his feet, Jesus would have worn leather boots because of all the walking he would have done.
